text: Bridgetown, looking west towards Totnes. Looking east towards Paignton. Bridgetown occupies the left bank of the Dart in the town of Totnes, Devon, England. It resulted from the first bridge being built across the river for the town. The river is in a valley, with Bridgetown on the south eastern slopes opposite Totnes. It has a tall C of E church with tower in the parish of Totnes with Bridgetown,https://www.achurchnearyou.com/search/?lat=50.430&lon;=-3.680 a village hall, two large grassy play areas, a dental surgery, a farm, a butcher, two small corner shops, a Chinese takeaway, one public house, which includes its own brewery, Longmarsh -- a riverside walk also used for military training, a rowing club, a caravan park and a veterinary clinic. ==References== ==External links== Category:Villages in Devon Category:Totnes
title: Bridgetown, Devon
